a couple concepts in flight the first concept is a task a task is the smallest
or the most indivisible part of the system it's it's an atomic unit of
execution essentially from our point of view in the simplest case it could be a container in the most complex case it
could be a distributed sparc execution so it's an entire cluster with the
execution and with the driver and the executors or it could also be a query that's running on a remote hosted yarn
cluster and one of the defining characteristics of a task is the
interface a task is like a function a pure function in many cases which takes
in a bunch of input data transforms it and produces an output and and and
having having a strongly typed interface gives you lots of advantages as we will see in the future but on the right hand
side I'm shown couple examples one on the right shows like it's a spark task
and it's showing how this is our Python SDK we saw flight comes with a Python

first one is a spark task it has a spark configuration that's how the users say
that I want 10 spark executors or excise driver and it automatically creates a cluster and runs it automatically and
the second example is running an arbitrary container it could which could be an arbitrary command which has a
bunch of data as input and produces some output once you have these tasks you can
string them along together into a dag a directed acyclic graph and we call them
as workflows workflows are also strongly typed they have an interface they have
inputs they produce outputs but they are purely in specification tasks are in specification with a
